meanings.definition: A large quantity or number of something
meanings.sent1: She had passels of toys scattered across the floor.
meanings.sent2: There were passels of people waiting in line for the concert.
meanings.sent3: The passels of candy in the jar tempted the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The passels of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The passels of colorful balloons filled the room with joy.

meanings.definition: To divide into or distribute in large quantities
meanings.sent1: The teacher decided to passels the candies among the students.
meanings.sent2: He passels the seeds evenly in the garden for planting.
meanings.sent3: She passels the paint on the canvas with artistic flair.
meanings.sent4: The wind passels the leaves across the yard in a swirling dance.
meanings.sent5: The chef passels the spices into the simmering pot for flavor.
